top_categories.workout_context: Mammoth Tuff’s high sierra alpine gravel—smooth and fast and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Mammoth Tuff rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Racing Mammoth Tuff isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
At 100 miles, Mammoth Tuff punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Mammoth Tuff when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Mammoth Tuff’s high sierra alpine gravel, smooth fast roads demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Mammoth Tuff. Make this intensity feel like home.
Every session at Mammoth Tuff intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Mammoth Tuff’s 7,500ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Mammoth Tuff — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on high sierra alpine gravel—smooth and fast.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Mammoth Tuff — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Mammoth Tuff’s high sierra alpine gravel—smooth and fast delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Mammoth Tuff’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Mammoth Tuff with 7,500ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. Altitude 7,880-8,000 ft (30% less oxygen); High altitude sun intensity.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Mammoth Tuff requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on high sierra alpine gravel—smooth and fast to build confidence. Expect: high sierra alpine gravel, smooth fast roads, june lake loop scenery.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on VO2max, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 100 miles of high sierra alpine gravel—smooth and fast in Mammoth Lakes, California.
